page.title: 03TRANSPORT-WENT HILLS & A1
page.content: The section of the A1 which passes through the area is very busy.People who live in the area rely on it to get to places quickly .Its link with the M62 is also important. Until fairly recently the road ran through the centre of the villages. There used to be several coaching inns which did a good trade. Most of these have now disappeared, but the villages still cater for tourists and other travellers. As the amount of traffic grew, it began to spoil the villages, making life uncomfortable and sometimes dangerous for the people living there. Today, Darrington has a flyover with access roads, while the A1 is carried over the Went Valley by a large viaduct, with a small loop road through the village. This is helpful for drivers who need a rest or a meal.
